profiles.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
clues: German composer from the late 18th and early 19th centuries
Famous for his nine symphonies, with the final one featuring the 'Ode to Joy'
Despite becoming completely deaf, continued to compose masterpieces
Revolutionary figure in the transition from Classical to Romantic music
His Fifth Symphony opens with the famous 'ta-ta-ta-taaa' motif
Born in Bonn and later moved to Vienna where he spent most of his life
Composed the Moonlight Sonata, one of the most famous piano pieces
His Ninth Symphony was the first to incorporate a full chorus and vocal soloists
Known for his passionate and dramatic compositions
His deafness was caused by a medical condition that began in his late twenties
Composed over 200 works including symphonies, concertos, and chamber music
His hearing loss did not prevent him from achieving his greatest works
The famous 'Heiligenstadt Testament' was written during his struggle with deafness
His works were dedicated to various nobility and patrons
Bridged the gap between the Classical and Romantic periods in classical music
His funeral was attended by thousands of people in Vienna
Created some of the most emotionally powerful music ever written
His sketches and notes show the detailed process of his compositions
Influenced countless composers who came after him
His legacy continues to be celebrated in concert halls worldwide

profiles.name: The Beatles
clues: British rock band formed in Liverpool in 1960
Consisted of four members who became some of the most famous musicians in history
Their album 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' revolutionized pop music
Known for constantly experimenting with new recording techniques and sounds
Broke up in 1970 after a decade of incredible success
Released 'Abbey Road' which featured a famous zebra crossing on its cover
Their album 'The White Album' is one of the best-selling albums of all time
Performed on the 'Ed Sullivan Show' in 1964 to a record-breaking television audience
Two of their members continued solo careers and were tragically murdered
Their music influenced an entire generation and beyond
Created innovative music videos that helped establish the format
Their early style was influenced by American rock and roll and R&B
Later albums featured orchestral arrangements and avant-garde techniques
Won multiple Grammy Awards during their career
Their song catalog is one of the most valuable in music history
The band's internal creative tensions eventually led to their breakup
Performed at the 1969 Woodstock Festival before their official breakup
Their acoustic recordings remain some of the most beloved songs ever
The group revolutionized the concept of the rock album as an art form
Their influence on music, fashion, and culture is immeasurable

profiles.name: Aretha Franklin
clues: American soul and R&B singer known as the 'Queen of Soul'
Her powerful voice and emotional delivery influenced generations of artists
Born in Memphis, Tennessee and raised in Detroit, Michigan
Father was a famous gospel preacher which influenced her early music
Hit songs include 'Respect', 'Think', and 'I Say a Little Prayer'
Known for her incredible ability to convey emotion through her singing
Won 18 Grammy Awards throughout her legendary career
Her rendition of 'Respect' became an anthem for women's rights
Recorded music across multiple decades from the 1960s onwards
Known for her powerful vocal range and improvisation skills
Performed at the inauguration of President Barack Obama
Started singing gospel music as a child in her father's church
Her album 'I Never Loved a Man the Way I Love You' launched her career
Collaborated with many famous musicians throughout her career
Her music blended soul, gospel, R&B, and pop influences
Known for her distinctive style and commanding stage presence
Her songs continue to be covered by artists of various genres
Faced personal challenges throughout her life but used them in her art
Regarded as one of the most important figures in American music history
Her legacy influenced countless soul and R&B artists who followed

profiles.name: Jazz Music
clues: An American musical genre that originated in New Orleans in the early 20th century
Combines elements of African rhythms, European harmony, and blues
Characterized by improvisation, complex harmonies, and syncopated rhythms
Evolved from ragtime, blues, and European classical music influences
Features instruments like trumpet, saxophone, trombone, piano, and double bass
Known for musicians playing off each other in a conversational style
Gained popularity in speakeasies during the Prohibition era
Spread globally and influenced music, fashion, and culture worldwide
Key figures include Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington, and Charlie Parker
Free improvisation is central to the genre's identity and appeal
Created distinct subgenres including bebop, cool jazz, and modal jazz
Musicians often communicate through their instruments during performances
The genre values individual expression and creative freedom
Developed standards that are performed and reinterpreted by countless artists
Known for live performances that are never the same twice
Influenced the development of rock, funk, and hip-hop music
Features complex chord progressions and sophisticated musical structures
Represents a uniquely American contribution to world music culture
Continues to evolve with modern artists experimenting with fusion styles
Celebrated in festivals and concert halls around the world

profiles.name: David Bowie
clues: British rock musician and cultural icon known for constant reinvention
Famous for his androgynous style and theatrical performances
Created the alter ego Ziggy Stardust in the early 1970s
His album 'The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars' was revolutionary
Known for collaborating with other famous artists and producers
Hit songs include 'Space Oddity', 'Heroes', and 'Let's Dance'
His career spanned five decades with continual evolution and experimentation
Died in January 2016 after a private battle with cancer
Released his final album 'Blackstar' on his birthday, just two days before his death
Influenced fashion as much as he influenced music
Known for his striking appearance and innovative music videos
Worked extensively in film, acting in movies and creating soundtracks
His album 'Hunky Dory' featured timeless classics like 'Changes'
Pioneered electronic and synthesizer-based rock music
Collaborated with Brian Eno on several groundbreaking albums
His performances were theatrical productions, not just concerts
Known for his distinctive vocal range and experimental approach
Helped establish the concept of rock as artistic and challenging medium
His influence on music, fashion, and culture remains profound
Often cited as one of the greatest artists of the 20th century

profiles.name: Elvis Presley
clues: American rock and roll pioneer who became a global superstar
Known as the 'King of Rock and Roll'
Hit songs include 'Hound Dog', 'Jailhouse Rock', and 'Can't Help Falling in Love'
His unique hip movements caused controversy during television performances
Served in the United States Army from 1958 to 1960
Had a successful career in Hollywood films alongside his music career
Known for his distinctive voice that blended country, blues, and rock styles
Performed at the historic 1968 comeback special on television
Starred in 31 films throughout his career
Known for his signature hairstyle and fashionable jumpsuits
Influenced countless rock musicians who came after him
Recorded at Sun Studio early in his career under Sam Phillips
His friendship and professional relationship with Colonel Tom Parker shaped his career
Released numerous number-one hits throughout the 1950s and 1960s
Had multiple Grammy Awards during his career
Performed regularly in Las Vegas from 1969 until his death
His personal life was often as newsworthy as his professional achievements
Died in 1977 at his Graceland mansion in Memphis
His estate remains one of the most visited tourist attractions in the United States
Remains one of the best-selling music artists of all time

profiles.name: Michael Jackson
clues: American pop icon known as the 'King of Pop'
Rose to fame as the youngest member of The Jackson 5
His solo album 'Thriller' became the best-selling album of all time
Known for his innovative and iconic dance moves, especially the moonwalk
His music videos were short films that advanced the medium
Hit songs include 'Billie Jean', 'Beat It', and 'Black or White'
Known for his distinctive high-pitched singing voice
Wore a single sequined glove during performances
His career spanned several decades with continued reinvention
Won 13 Grammy Awards during his lifetime
Owned the Neverland Ranch, a personal amusement park
His skin tone gradually lightened throughout his life
Was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame twice
Collaborated with renowned producer Quincy Jones
His performances were known for elaborate choreography and stage design
Released the album 'Bad' which featured socially conscious themes
Supported numerous charitable causes throughout his life
Died in 2009 from a drug overdose administered by his personal physician
His death was one of the most heavily covered events in media history
His influence on pop culture and music remains unmatched

profiles.name: Prince
clues: American musician, singer, and composer known for his genre-blending style
Born Prince Rogers Nelson in Minneapolis, Minnesota
Known as an incredibly talented multi-instrumentalist
His album 'Purple Rain' was both a commercial and critical success
Hit songs include 'When Doves Cry', 'Kiss', and 'Let's Go Crazy'
Famous for his androgynous appearance and fearless fashion choices
Released music across rock, funk, soul, and pop genres
Known for his distinctive high vocals and powerful guitar playing
Changed his stage name to an unpronounceable symbol in the 1990s
Owned and controlled his own record label and production company
Was a prolific songwriter and producer for other artists
Starred in the film 'Purple Rain' which became a cultural phenomenon
Known for his energetic and lengthy live performances
Won 7 Grammy Awards throughout his career
Fought for artistic control and ownership of his master recordings
Had an extensive vault of unreleased music
Collaborated with artists from various musical genres
Known for his role as both musician and visual artist
Died in 2016 from a drug overdose at Paisley Park
His influence on music, fashion, and gender expression was revolutionary

profiles.name: Queen
clues: British rock band fronted by the legendary Freddie Mercury
Known for their theatrical live performances and operatic rock style
Hit songs include 'Bohemian Rhapsody', 'We Will Rock You', and 'Another One Bites the Dust'
Formed in London in 1970 and became one of the greatest rock bands ever
Each member was a talented songwriter contributing to the band's unique sound
Freddie Mercury's vocal range was extraordinary and instantly recognizable
Known for elaborate stage productions and costume design
Released the album 'A Night at the Opera' which featured their signature hit
Performed at the 1985 Live Aid concert with one of the greatest live rock performances
Their music blended rock, opera, music hall, and progressive elements
Won multiple Grammy Awards during their career
Freddie Mercury died of AIDS-related complications in 1991
Their influence on rock music and live performance continues today
Known for their complex harmonies and multi-layered production
The band reunited for performances with guest vocalists after Mercury's death
Their songs remain staples of sporting events and celebrations worldwide
The 2018 film 'Bohemian Rhapsody' renewed interest in the band
Brian May is known for his distinctive curly hair and red guitar
Roger Taylor's drumming was powerful and innovative
John Deacon's bass lines were integral to their signature sound

profiles.name: The Rolling Stones
clues: British rock band formed in 1962 and one of the longest-running bands in history
Led by Mick Jagger who became a legendary rock frontman
Known for their blues-influenced rock and roll style
Hit songs include 'Satisfaction', 'Sympathy for the Devil', and 'Brown Sugar'
Keith Richards is one of the most influential guitarists in rock history
The band's dynamic on stage was electric and captivating
Known for their rebellious image and controversial public behavior
Released numerous groundbreaking albums throughout the 1960s and 1970s
Their rivalry with The Beatles became a defining part of rock history
Won multiple Grammy Awards and inductions into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
Known for their extensive world tours that set records for attendance and revenue
The band continued touring and recording into the 21st century
Mick Jagger's stage presence and charisma defined rock frontman archetype
Their influence on rock music is immeasurable and ongoing
Known for their musical chemistry and improvisational abilities
The band weathered numerous personnel changes while maintaining their core identity
Brian Jones was the original founder and guitarist before his death
Charlie Watts provided steady drumming throughout most of the band's history
Their live performances are considered benchmark performances in rock history
The band's longevity is a testament to their musical talent and appeal

profiles.name: Madonna
clues: American pop icon who reinvented herself throughout multiple decades
Known as the 'Queen of Pop'
Hit songs include 'Like a Virgin', 'Vogue', and 'Material Girl'
Her career spanned from the 1980s through the 2020s with constant evolution
Known for her controversial music videos and performances
Her constant reinvention influenced pop culture and music video aesthetics
Hit albums include 'Like a Prayer' and 'Ray of Light'
Known for pushing boundaries in fashion, sexuality, and artistic expression
Was a trained dancer before becoming a pop superstar
Her live performances set standards for pop concert production
Won multiple Grammy Awards and other prestigious music awards
Her romantic relationships often became media sensations
Adopted multiple children from Africa and became an activist
Married and divorced multiple times, including with film director Guy Ritchie
Her influence on pop music and music videos cannot be overstated
Known for her ability to stay relevant across different musical eras
Her business acumen made her one of the wealthiest female entertainers
Her tours were among the highest-grossing concert tours of all time
Her provocative approach to sexuality challenged cultural norms
Remained a cultural icon and trendsetter into her 60s

profiles.name: Bob Dylan
clues: American musician and poet who revolutionized popular music
Known as one of the most influential songwriters in history
Won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2016
His folk-rock songs became anthems for social and political movements
Hit songs include 'Blowin' in the Wind' and 'The Times They Are a-Changin''
Famously went electric at the Newport Folk Festival in 1965
His poetic lyrics elevated popular music to an art form
Born Robert Allen Zimmerman in Minnesota
His early career was rooted in folk music before evolving into rock
Known for his distinctive raspy singing voice
His albums were critically acclaimed and commercially successful
Influenced countless musicians across multiple generations
His songwriting approach emphasized metaphor and social commentary
He won multiple Grammy Awards including a Lifetime Achievement Award
His personal life was often as scrutinized as his professional work
Known for his enigmatic public persona and privacy
His influence on rock, folk, and popular music is immeasurable
Released numerous albums that became cultural touchstones
Was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
Continued recording and performing into his late years

profiles.name: Jimi Hendrix
clues: American rock guitarist and singer-songwriter who revolutionized the instrument

Introduced innovative guitar techniques including feedback and distortion
Hit songs include 'Purple Haze', 'Foxy Lady', and 'All Along the Watchtower'
His album 'Are You Experienced' became an instant classic
Died at age 27 in 1970, becoming part of the '27 Club'
Born in Seattle, Washington
Started his career after being discovered performing in London
His guitar playing revolutionized rock music and inspired generations
Known for his unorthodox approach to guitar playing and sound effects
His live performances were legendary for their intensity and innovation
Influenced every guitarist who came after him

Known for his distinctive voice and emotional delivery
His album 'Electric Lady' showcased his recording sophistication
His performance at Woodstock 1969 is considered one of the greatest live rock performances
Was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
His legacy continues to influence rock musicians
Won Grammy Hall of Fame awards for his recordings
Considered one of the most important figures in rock history

profiles.name: Led Zeppelin
clues: British rock band formed in 1968 and one of the most influential bands ever
Fronted by Robert Plant with guitarist Jimmy Page

Hit songs include 'Whole Lotta Love', 'Stairway to Heaven', and 'Black Dog'
Their album 'IV' featured the iconic 'Stairway to Heaven'
Known for their live performances which were legendary for their energy

Their music blended blues, folk, and hard rock elements
Won multiple Grammy Awards and inductions into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
Their records were among the best-selling of all time
Known for their mystical and occult-influenced imagery
Disbanded in 1980 following the death of drummer John Bonham
Their reunion concert in 2007 was one of the most anticipated musical events
Robert Plant's vocals were powerful and emotionally resonant
Jimmy Page's guitar work was innovative and influential
John Paul Jones provided sophisticated arrangements on keyboards and bass
John Bonham's drumming set the standard for rock percussion
Their influence on heavy metal and hard rock is immeasurable
Their legacy remains one of the most important in rock history
Many consider them the greatest rock band of all time

profiles.name: The Who
clues: British rock band formed in 1964 known for their rebellious energy
Fronted by Roger Daltrey with guitarist Pete Townshend
Known for their rock operas including 'Tommy' and 'Quadrophenia'

Known for their energetic and destructive live performances
Pete Townshend was known for smashing his guitar on stage

Won multiple Grammy Awards and inductions into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
Their music influenced punk and alternative rock
Drummer Keith Moon was known for his wild lifestyle and antics
The band continued performing well into the 21st century
Their songs became anthems for generations of rock fans
Known for their powerful chord progressions and dynamic arrangements
Roger Daltrey's powerful vocals defined their signature sound
Pete Townshend's songwriting was innovative and socially conscious
John Entwistle provided intricate bass lines
Their live performances remained legendary throughout their career
They were known for their mod fashion and rebellious image
Their influence on rock music and performance art is significant
Many of their songs remain timeless classics

profiles.name: Louis Armstrong
clues: American jazz musician and singer who revolutionized jazz
Known as the 'Father of Jazz Soloing'

Hit songs include 'What a Wonderful World' and 'Hello, Dolly!'
Born in New Orleans, Louisiana
His scat singing technique influenced vocal jazz
Known for his distinctive gravelly voice and warm personality
His career spanned several decades and multiple musical eras

His influence on jazz and popular music is immeasurable
Recorded numerous albums and appeared in films
Known for his charismatic personality and showmanship
His improvisational skills set the standard for jazz musicians

His recordings remain some of the most important in jazz history
He broke racial barriers during the segregation era
Known for his distinctive trumpet tone and innovative phrasing
His live performances were characterized by joy and authenticity
Considered one of the greatest musicians of the 20th century

profiles.name: Billie Holiday
clues: American jazz singer and songwriter known as the 'Lady of Jazz'

Hit songs include 'Strange Fruit', 'God Bless the Child', and 'Lady Sings the Blues'
Born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Her powerful emotional delivery influenced generations of singers
Known for her innovative phrasing and interpretations
Her career was marked by both extraordinary talent and personal struggles
Died at age 44 due to complications from heroin addiction
Her autobiography became a classic in music literature
Won Grammy Awards and other prestigious music honors
Her influence on jazz and popular music is profound
Known for her ability to convey deep emotion through her voice

Her rendition of 'Strange Fruit' became a political statement
Known for her distinctive style and fashion sense
Her recordings remain timeless and frequently covered by other artists

profiles.name: Pink Floyd

Known for their elaborate light shows and visual presentations

Roger Waters was the primary songwriter and bassist

Won multiple Grammy Awards and inductions into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
Their albums were commercially successful and critically acclaimed
Known for their experimental approach to rock music
Their live performances were known for their production and artistic vision
Their influence on progressive rock and concept albums is significant
They were pioneers in using the recording studio as an instrument
Their music continues to be relevant and influential
Their albums are among the best-selling of all time
The band reunited for a benefit concert in 2005
Considered one of the greatest rock bands in history

Known for her emotional ballads and powerful vocal range

Her career rose to prominence in the late 2000s

Known for her authentic approach to songwriting and performance
Her albums topped charts in multiple countries
She won multiple Grammys for Record of the Year and Song of the Year
Her influence on contemporary pop and soul music is significant
Known for her reluctance to discuss her personal life publicly
Her albums frequently featured intimate piano-based arrangements
She maintained her artistic integrity while achieving massive commercial success
Considered one of the greatest vocalists of the 21st century

She donated her earnings to charitable causes
Her songwriting is known for its clever wordplay and emotional depth
She transitioned from country to pop with critical acclaim

His music is characterized by elegance, harmony, and innovation
Influenced composers including Beethoven and countless others

Known for his melodic genius and compositional brilliance
His concertos for various instruments are still performed regularly
His influence on classical music is immeasurable
Experienced financial difficulties despite his talent
His personal life included marriage and family challenges
His legacy made him one of the most important composers ever

profiles.name: Kurt Cobain

His mystique grew after his death
His music continues to resonate with audiences
He was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame

His personal struggles highlighted issues of mental health
Considered one of the most important figures in 1990s music

Considered one of the greatest musicians ever
